channel.title: News - South China Morning Post
channel.description: All the latest breaking news from Hong Kong, China and around the world

item.title: China-reliant Gabon finds oil-free, green future in its forests
item.description: The small African country’s environment minister talked climate financing at the IMF’s spring meeting as the need to replace oil revenues grows.
item.dc:creator: Jevans Nyabiage
item.author: Jevans Nyabiage

item.title: Ukraine war: CIA wants ‘concerned Russians’ to contact it on the darknet
item.description: The CIA is in a new push to promote its presence on a part of the internet accessible only through specialised tools that provide more anonymity.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Australian man jailed for 12 years over 1988 cliff murder of gay American
item.description: Scott White was also awarded a non-parole period of 99 months for the murder of mathematician Scott Johnson three decades ago.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Ukraine war: US says Russia’s top general Valery Gerasimov visited Donbas front where Kyiv claimed deadly attack
item.description: The United States believes that the Russian military’s Chief of the General Staff, Valery Gerasimov, visited Ukraine’s Donbas region last week but cannot confirm media reports that he was wounded during fighting.
item.dc:creator: Agencies
item.author: Agencies

item.title: Cross-harbour section of Hong Kong’s most expensive rail project to fully open on May 15
item.description: Tests, trial runs for Hung Hom-Admiralty section of Sha Tin-Central rail link completed and ready for launch in mid-May.
item.dc:creator: Cannix Yau
item.author: Cannix Yau

item.title: China’s ‘rotten-tail buildings’: homebuyers in limbo for years with no home due to dodgy developers and red tape
item.description: Chinese homebuyers who fall afoul of broke developers and bureaucratic disinterest sometimes wait a decade to move into dream homes which often have no power, water or basic amenities.
item.dc:creator: Yingjie Wang
item.author: Yingjie Wang

item.title: Coronavirus: Hong Kong kindergartens reopen after 4-month suspension but mandatory daily Covid tests mean earlier start for some
item.description: Government earlier said a third of kindergarten pupils would be allowed to return to their classrooms from Tuesday, another third on May 10 and the rest on May 16.
item.dc:creator: William Yiu
item.author: William Yiu

item.title: Japan says Chinese aircraft carrier Liaoning sailed near Okinawa islands
item.description: The defence ministry said eight naval vessels, including the carrier, transited through the islands in Okinawa.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: US primaries will test Donald Trump’s sway with Republicans
item.description: The month of May brings Donald Trump the biggest test of his political clout since the end of his presidency.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Coronavirus: Shanghai adds 73 new Covid-19 cases outside quarantine zones, putting societal zero-Covid goal further out of reach
item.description: The increase in cases, from 58 a day earlier, follows two case-free days that had raised hopes about lockdown curbs. However, overall progress continues, as new cases fell for the 10th straight day.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Ren
item.author: Daniel Ren

item.title: Man held in eastern China on national security, overseas collusion charges
item.description: The person, surnamed Ma, is said to be an IT company department head who has been in custody since April 25 and could face life imprisonment.
item.dc:creator: Shi Jiangtao
item.author: Shi Jiangtao

item.title: Coronavirus: Hong Kong to ease more social-distancing rules on Thursday, allowing 8 per table at restaurants ‘ahead of Mother’s Day’
item.description: Cap on patrons per table at eateries to be expanded to eight from the current four, while beaches, swimming pools and water playgrounds can reopen.
item.dc:creator: Lilian Cheng,Chris Lau
item.author: Lilian Cheng,Chris Lau

item.title: HSBC and Ping An log early gains as investors await ‘debate’ about insurer’s push to split the bank’s Asia business for a Hong Kong listing
item.description: The lender’s CEO Noel Quinn defended HSBC’s geographic span, saying the 156-year-old bank has the right strategy as the global financier for trade between East and the West.
item.dc:creator: SCMP Reporter
item.author: SCMP Reporter

item.title: Leak suggests US Supreme Court set to strike down abortion rights
item.description: The US Supreme Court is ready to overturn Roe vs Wade and allow states to outlaw abortion, according to purported draft opinion that was leaked to Politico.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Zero-Covid at all costs is exposing the flaws in China’s top-down approach
item.description: China’s uncertainty over the consequences of relaxing pandemic rules is driving its dogged approach, with local governments forced to take drastic measures to meet objectives. Yet such inflexibility, amid greater awareness of the virus and at the expense of livelihoods, is fuelling discontent.
item.dc:creator: Jinyuan Li
item.author: Jinyuan Li

item.title: From 20,000 views to 59.3 million fans, a fitness instructor sees his social media explode by posting lockdown exercise videos
item.description: A Taiwan fitness instructor saw his social media presence skyrocket as he tailors exercise videos for the millions of Chinese people stuck in Covid-19 lockdowns.
item.dc:creator: Alice Yan
item.author: Alice Yan

item.title: Bilibili seeks dual-primary listing in Hong Kong by October 3, as short video platform moves to bolster home ties
item.description: Nasdaq-listed Bilibili is among a host of US-listed mainland companies seeking secondary or primary flotations closer to home amid tighter audit requirements.
item.dc:creator: Enoch Yiu
item.author: Enoch Yiu

item.title: Independent self-help tools flourish outside Big Tech platforms as Shanghai’s residents come together to beat lockdown
item.description: Several self-help digital websites and tools have surfaced to handle a bigger volume of requests or to suit special purposes amid Shanghai lockdown.
item.dc:creator: Yaling Jiang
item.author: Yaling Jiang

item.title: US trade chief signals China tariff relief an option as prices soar
item.description: Biden’s top trade negotiator Katherine Tai warned, however, that the tools the US deploys to fight inflation must not undermine the goal of changing the relationship with Beijing.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: North Korea’s ‘possible’ nuclear missile test in focus as China envoy visits Seoul
item.description: China’s Liu Xiaoming will meet counterpart Noh Kyu-duk to assess the ‘grave’ situation on the Korean peninsula; Pyongyang’s plans for an upcoming test could involve warheads it deems will give it an upper hand in conflict.
item.dc:creator: Park Chan-kyong
item.author: Park Chan-kyong

item.title: Mali’s junta breaks off from defence accords with France
item.description: The government’s relationship with the country’s former colonial ruler continues to deteriorate, even as it builds ties with Russia.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Ukraine war: White House ties missiles used by Kyiv to its China competition bill
item.description: Press secretary Jen Psaki frames legislation to subsidise domestic chip manufacturing, originally seen as needed to stay competitive with China, as helpful to production of Javelin missiles.
item.dc:creator: Robert Delaney
item.author: Robert Delaney

item.title: The cloud of anti-Western nationalism hanging over China’s Communist Party congress
item.description: From Ukraine to Covid-19, nationalist takes are dominating public debate online.
item.dc:creator: Jun Mai
item.author: Jun Mai

item.title: China’s dynamic zero Covid policy may mean endless nucleic testing for millions of people
item.description: China is entering a new normal of “dynamic zero” Covid-19 policy, in which citizens are subject to frequent nucleic-acid tests regardless of a person’s likelihood of contracting the coronavirus.
item.dc:creator: Zhou Xin
item.author: Zhou Xin

item.title: Hong Kong parents fret over daily Covid-19 swab tests for children as kindergartens resume face-to-face classes
item.description: Worried about causing nosebleeds in children, some parents plot ways to get around government rule on daily rapid antigen tests.
item.dc:creator: William Yiu
item.author: William Yiu

item.title: Reviving tourism means making Hong Kong more welcoming and sustainable
item.description: What has worked for Hong Kong in the past probably won’t succeed in a world that is supposed to be focused on climate change and sustainability. Rethinking how to promote the city and making visitors feel more welcome are essential to restoring Hong Kong’s battered reputation.
item.dc:creator: Peter Kammerer
item.author: Peter Kammerer

item.title: Russia steps up Ukraine assault as US warns of annexation
item.description: After failing to take Kyiv, Moscow has shifted its invasion to largely Russian-speaking areas and has stepped up pressure on the key port of Odesa.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Push to arm Ukraine putting strain on US weapons stockpile
item.description: A depleted US inventory of Javelins, Stingers and other arms could be an issue if a new conflict erupts with North Korea, Iran or elsewhere.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Arrest warrant issued for US jail official, who went missing with murder suspect
item.description: Vicky White is accused of helping inmate Casey Cole White escape from an Alabama prison; a hunt is on for the duo, who authorities say are probably armed and should be considered dangerous.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: China’s giant gold deposit was formed by different geological forces, says paper. Is there more out there?
item.description: Dongping deposit was formed by magmatic fluids mixing with rainwater, a process different from gold found in other parts of the world, say researchers.
item.dc:creator: Holly Chik
item.author: Holly Chik

item.title: Ukraine war: Germany woos India with G7 invite in bid to isolate Russia
item.description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz hosted PM Narendra Modi in Berlin, saying he was ready to continue – and expand – their close cooperation on global issues.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: Threat of Russian nuclear attack shows why China’s no-first-use policy should be global standard
item.description: While nuclear weapons use is often labelled unthinkable, after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, that option now seems to be on the table. China has long had a clear no-first-use policy, but the US does not commit to this, stressing nuclear deterrence instead.
item.dc:creator: Tom Plate
item.author: Tom Plate

item.title: Ukraine war: First evacuees to leave Mariupol steel plant arrive safely after ordeal
item.description: Some civilian evacuees reached Zaporizhzhia from Russian occupied territory on Monday morning after making their own way; one convoy was delayed as buses had not reached the agreed pickup point.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Beijing centralises power in the provinces ahead of Communist Party congress
item.description: Guangdong reshuffle a case study in growing practice of appointing hand-picked outsiders to key provincial roles.
item.dc:creator: Mimi Lau
item.author: Mimi Lau

item.title: Close ally of Xi Jinping named new head of influential Chinese think tank
item.description: Shi Taifeng, 65, has been appointed president of the state-backed Chinese Academy of Social Sciences.
item.dc:creator: Jack Lau
item.author: Jack Lau

item.title: India’s unrelenting heat pushes April power demand to record high, crisis risk
item.description: Hottest pre-summer in decades prompts surge in the use of air conditioning, triggering the worst power crisis in years; scientists have linked the early onset of an intense summer to climate change.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Investigators raid Japan boat tour company’s office after sinking
item.description: The Kazu 1 sightseeing boat started the tour in Shiretoko National Park, Hokkaido, on April 23, despite forecast rough seas and warnings from other tour operators; on board were two crew and 24 passengers, including two children.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Security guards, hotpot meals and photo shoots among election expenses of Hong Kong hopefuls for new Legco constituency
item.description: Election expense accounts candidates filed to electoral authorities show the biggest spender running in the constituency shelled out HK$204,240 but failed to win a seat.
item.dc:creator: Ng Kang-chung
item.author: Ng Kang-chung

item.title: At least 20 per cent of tenants in Hong Kong’s subdivided flats could be overcharged for utilities, survey shows
item.description: Only some landlords provided water and electricity bills for reference, meaning other tenants may have no idea if they are being overcharged, survey by Concerning Grassroot Housing Rights Alliance shows.
item.dc:creator: Edith Lin
item.author: Edith Lin

item.title: Australian man admits he pushed US mathematician off cliff in apparent gay hate crime in 1988
item.description: Scott White pleaded guilty to murdering Scott Johnson, whose death was dismissed as suicide 34 years ago; ex-wife told how he ‘bragged’ to their children about beating up gay men at clifftop.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Chinese insurance giant Ping An calls for debate on HSBC’s future as it pushes potential break-up
item.description: Ping An, HSBC’s biggest shareholder, said it ‘supports all reforms and proposals from investors that can help HSBC’s operations and long-term growth’ in its first public comments after reportedly pushing to break up the bank.
item.dc:creator: Chad Bray
item.author: Chad Bray

item.title: Japan, Thai PMs meet over Ukraine crisis, defence cooperation
item.description: PMs Fumio Kishida and Prayut Chan-o-cha are seeking to reach an agreement on the transfer of Japanese defence equipment; Thailand has been cautious about joining efforts to isolate Russia in response to its aggression.
item.dc:creator: Kyodo
item.author: Kyodo

item.title: Weibo’s new policy to display user locations prompts some humour among netizens as Gates, Musk and Cook appear to be based in China
item.description: Weibo accounts of Western tech gurus are likely run by entities or teams based in China on their behalf, acting as one-way PR channels.
item.dc:creator: Xinmei Shen
item.author: Xinmei Shen

item.title: Russian natural gas exports to China jump 60 per cent in first 4 months
item.description: It comes as major buyers, especially in Europe, have cut imports following Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Liu Zhen
item.author: Liu Zhen

item.title: Electric cars: China’s EV buyers may receive cash subsidies from local governments aiming to bolster industry walloped by Covid-19 lockdowns, say analysts
item.description: Analysts said that Jilin and local authorities in East China’s Yangtze River Delta, such as Shanghai, Jiangsu and Zhejiang will probably grant cash subsidies to promote sales of EVs.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Ren
item.author: Daniel Ren

item.title: Philippine election: Who is Bongbong Marcos, what’s his platform and China views, and why can’t he visit the US?
item.description: Philippine presidential frontrunner Marcos Jnr and his family face arrest in the US for defying a court order to pay US$353 million to human-rights victims.
item.dc:creator: Alan Robles
item.author: Alan Robles

item.title: Elizabeth Zhong murder: Victim’s ex-boyfriend testifies at Fang Sun trial in New Zealand
item.description: David Zheng denies owing money to Zhong, but admits US$50,000 is tied up in company they started and US$20,000 frozen in Chinese bank account; Zhong was stabbed more than 20 times during a knife attack in her home.
item.dc:creator: The New Zealand Herald
item.author: The New Zealand Herald

item.title: Chinese tier-one cities lose their shine in wake of strict Covid-19 restrictions
item.description: Various factors had already contributed to a growth slowdown in China’s biggest cities, but the Covid-19 pandemic has accelerated the trend.
item.dc:creator: Mandy Zuo
item.author: Mandy Zuo

item.title: Israel lashes out at Russia over Lavrov’s Nazism remarks, says they’re ‘unforgivable’
item.description: Lavrov’s statement that Hitler had Jewish origins is ‘unforgivable and scandalous and a horrible historical error’, Israeli Foreign Minister Yair Lapid said.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: How Tata used ‘jugaad’ to become India’s EV leader
item.description: The housing-to-aerospace giant employed a flexible approach to problem-solving to make an affordable electric car for the country’s extremely cost-conscious population.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters
